questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site on the Italian peninsula was famously preserved by volcanic ash in 79 AD?
questions.context: Pompeii was buried under 6 meters of ash after the eruption of Mount Vesuvius, providing a unique snapshot of Roman life.

questions.question: What site in China, completed in 1420, served as the political heart of the Ming and Qing Dynasties and is one of the world's largest UNESCO-listed palatial complexes?
questions.context: The Forbidden City has nearly 1,000 buildings and once housed 24 Chinese Emperors.

questions.question: Which UNESCO-listed site in South America is noted for its collection of gigantic stone heads, created by the indigenous Rapa Nui people?
questions.context: Located on Easter Island, these monuments are known as 'moai' and were carved between 1400 and 1650 AD.

questions.question: What awe-inspiring valley in Egypt, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, contains the tombs of pharaohs such as Tutankhamun?
questions.context: This ancient burial ground on the Nile's west bank was used for over 500 years during the New Kingdom.

questions.question: What famous architectural wonder, found in the city of Agra, was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site primarily for its Mughal architectural style?
questions.context: Constructed by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, it is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
